comment: Dr. Karam is probably the best teacher KSU still has from SPSU. He is funny and all your programs have to do is pass the unit tests to pass. 10/10 Would take again.

Friendly teacher and willing to work with anyone after class. I have no idea why someone said the level of work is high. There were 10 coding homeworks and 2 tests. Everyone got 100% credit for all the homeworks except for one person. The tests both had extra credit points. If anything the class was a bit too easy. Accent is not perfect but OK.

Dr. Karam is a funny, passionate instructor who wants his students to succeed. This was my first graduate class, so I was a little unprepared for the level of work required, but I learned so much from his class. I wish he taught more of the required classes for me degree. 10/10 Would take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Boy has this guy fallen from grace. It's a good thing that this guy got a job at Microsoft, bc you can tell that he is burned out teaching. Absolutely no passion for teaching, or seeing the students succeed. He hands out the same boring material each semester. Grades on a curve... What a complete waste of time, and money.

An excellent professor, but you should know three things: you only get partial credit if your code compiles and runs, his tests are so similar to the "sample" tests it hurts to see people do badly, and he's a good and fair teacher but you're going to have to actually spend several hours a week on your programs for his class.

Karam is a great teacher. He explains things with exaamples and provides TONS of practice tests to help you prepare. As long as you do the homework assignments you will ace the course. He provides challenging examples that have followed me through to the real world. The final project is NOT hard, you just have to do it. Very much matches expectatio

Professor Karam was an excellent teacher. I had him for Database in Summer 2010 and  if you didn't know what databases were before entering his class you will definitely know what hey are before the semester ends. He has such a great attitude and is always willing to help so ask questions if you need to. I gave him a 10/10

One of the best Professors I've had at SPSU. He's beyond friendly and is very passionate about what he teaches. His class is alot of work though. Prepare for some assignments and a big final project. Not to mention the final is comprehensive( just study your old test...). Overall a great teacher that I highly suggest you taking

Very well intentioned but not so hot on delivery. His accent reminds me of StrongBad and he unable to use pronouns effectively. His expectations of students are unrealistic in terms of the breadth of busy work he assigns. I have usually regret asking him or his TA (Jeff) for help because they are more interested in being smug than providing advice.
useless instructor ... biting my tongue ... avoid him at all cost ... don'listento what these other people say

Dr Karam is a good instructor. He is obviously very interested in the material and wants to ensure that students understand. The only problem was that the material was not challenging enough. I found myself learning more about PHP than SQL, and sadly, I'm not interested in PHP at all. The fact that he can teach without a textbook is a testament.

Dr. Karam is one of the best professors I've had.  He strives to teach the material well.  If you follow his instructions and ask questions when needed, you should easily get an A in his class.  If you get stomped on a problem, go to his office and ask questions. The subject is challenging but Karam makes it easy.

I just took Database systems this Summer 09 and I think he is a good professor. He delivers the material very well. Also all his material is online so you should not have a problem understanding. However, he expects you to work hard on his project; If you take this class be prepare to do a lot of work and should you should come out with an A or B.

He is a great prof. I wish I could take more classes with him. He is very helpfull, he tries his best to make sure you understand the subject. Assignments are really helpful. His final project is very important and it takes time, but the project will help you to practice what you've learned. He is very nice, take him don't try anybody else.
Database Class was very interesting and entertaining. Overall a very good and fairly easy class.

Prof Karam is very nice and his humor allows him to communicate with students on their level. His tests seemed hard. There is no 1 right answer in DB so if you give it a ggod shot you do well. If your test scores are low you can make up for it in the final project.

Karam is the man! He talks like Strong Bad, but he's not hard to understand. Really funny, very helpful if you ask questions. Lazy at grading and stingy with extra credit, so push him so you know where you stand grade-wise.

DB Management. This professor is entertaining (heavy accent and talks like a high school nerd, it funny). His teaching ability is less than par.  50% of the time, no one understood his "clarifying" remarks of textbook material. Tests are easy at start of semester.  SQL exams are INSANE.  80% of class, and I, failed the final. I still got an A.

He knows his stuff very well but he wasnt very clear in teaching it and because of his accent he is hard to understand anyways.  I think he could have done a little better of a job teaching the material though.  I would recommend him if this is something your really interested in.
Hard to understand sometimes, heavy accent. He doesn't accept and can't read papers written in cursive. On the other hand, he knows what he's talking about.
not helpful

he's a really cool teacher, and class is usually pretty fun. just be careful - he's got a very laid back/chilled out personality, but don't expect him to grade as leniently as his personality suggests.  it's not that he grades unfairly, he can just be somewhat stingy with partial credit at times.

Orlando is SPSU's resident UNIX god. Without his guidance, I doubt I would have ventured much further into the OS. Wonderful teacher, very mindful of student progress, adjusts cuuriculum to suit students and to teach what he sees is needed.  Overall great professor.

Prof Karam is a great prof. He makes the lectures entertaining one way or another. He is very clear and always asks the class("does this make sense") before proceeding to the next topic. Make sure to take him before you graduate from Poly.
